subject: News Summary
body:
CBSNews.com






April 25, 2007

TOP STORIESHouse Panel Subpoenas Rice On Iraq Claims
A House committee looking into discredited claims that Iraq was seeking uranium from Africa has subpoenaed Secretary of State
                        Condoleezza Rice. Another panel granted immunity to an ex-aide to Attorney General Gonzales in the prosecutor firings case. More...Watch: Bush: Gonzales Is Staying
• Feds Arrest Mail Bombing Suspect• Taliban: Bin Laden Behind Cheney Attack
                     					| Watch• Cops Hunt Killer Of N.Y. State TrooperU.S.Cops Don't Know Va. Tech Gunman's Motives
The massacre inside a chained-shut Norris Hall went on for nine minutes as Seung-Hui Cho fired off 170 rounds, killing 30
                        people before shooting himself in the head, police revealed Wednesday. More...Watch: Gun Control An Issue In Va.  
• Student Film Causes Campus Gun Scare• Jessica Lynch Sets Record Straight
                     					| Watch• Supreme Court Throws Out 3 Death Sentences• More StoriesWorldTaliban: Bin Laden Behind Cheney Attack
A top Taliban commander tells Al-Jazeera television that Osama bin Laden planned and supervised the February bombing outside
                        a U.S. military base in Afghanistan when Vice President Cheney was visiting. The bombing killed 23 people. More...Watch: Cheney Safe In Afghanistan
• Pakistan's Quiet Fight For Iran's Favor • A Final Farewell To Boris Yeltsin
                     					| Watch• Mugabe Losing Grip On Zimbabwe's Army• More StoriesPoliticsMcCain Makes It Official: He's Running 
Republican Sen. John McCain officially launched his campaign for the presidency with a speech in New Hampshire, selling himself
                        as a man with the experience to lead in wartime. "I know how to fight and how to make peace," he told voters. More...Watch: McCain Announces Candidacy
• House Panel Subpoenas Rice On Iraq Claims
                     					| Watch• Giuliani Says Dems Put U.S. At Risk
                     					| Watch• Obama Blasts Giuliani's Remarks• More StoriesHealthStudy: Being Smart Doesn't Make You Rich
Having a high IQ isn't money in the bank, according to new research that shows smarter doesn't necessarily mean richer. More...
• Tainted Pet Food Was Fed To Hogs
                     					| Watch• New Plan For Better Vets' Care• Study: Breastfed Tots No Thinner As Adults• More StoriesSciTechCalifornia To Sue EPA Over Air Standards
Gov. Arnold Schwarzenegger's administration will sue the Environmental Protection Agency for acting too slowly on California's
                        request to regulate greenhouse gas emissions from automobiles, a spokesman said. More...
• Crocodile To Be Set Up With Four Partners• New Planet Spotted, Could Be Habitable• Lye In Water Blamed For Burns, Rashes• More StoriesBusinessNew Home Sales Rebound In March
Sales of new homes rebounded slightly in March, helped by better weather, but the gain was not enough to offset big declines
                        in the previous two months. New homes were sold at a seasonally adjusted annual rate of 858,000 units in March. More...
• How To Make A Graceful Job Exit• Dow Climbs Above 13,000 For First Time
                     					| Watch• Metal Thieves Grow Brash• More StoriesEntertainmentRosie O'Donnell Leaving "The View"
"We couldn't come to terms with my deal with ABC, so next year I'm not going to be on 'The View,' " Rosie O'Donnell said Wednesday
                        after announcing her departure from the show. More...
• Opening Statements Begin In Spector Case
                     					| Watch• Team Gives Gift To Child Hit In End Zone
                     					| Watch• Alec Baldwin Leaves Talent Agency• More StoriesOpinionIran's Nukes No Match For Sanctions
Iran's elite, who have influence over nuclear-or-else President Ahmadinejad, dread economic sanctions; thus the U.S. and its
                        allies would be best off pursuing these if they want to avoid a Middle East arms race, explains The New Republic. More...Watch: Iran Expands Nuclear Program
• Give Progress A Chance In Iraq
                     					| Watch• Being No. 1 Is Over-Rated• Russia's Tragic Hero
                     					| Watch• More StoriesCBS NEWS BROADCASTSThe Early Show: Jessica Lynch Sets Record Straight
On Tuesday, former Army Pvt. Jessica Lynch testified in Washington about the real story of her capture and rescue while serving
                        in Iraq. She spoke before the House Government Reform Committee along with the family of fallen Army Ranger Pat Tillman. 
                         More...Watch: Lynch Discusses False Heroism
• EARLY SHOW: Team Gives Gift To Child Hit In End Zone

Pandas Ready For Hong KongCBS News RAW: Two pandas are being sent to Hong Kong as a gift from the Chinese government, as part of the 10th anniversary
                                    celebrations of the former British colony's return to China.
